definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])

sentences.english: Opportunity often comes disguised in the form of misfortune, or temporary defeat.
sentences.chinese: 機會經常隱臧在不幸煳暫時的失敗中。

sentences.english: We appreciated his devotion of time and money to the project.
sentences.chinese: 我們感謝他爲這一項目花費的時間煳金錢。

sentences.english: A method to control the corrosion of high temperature section is provided.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一種方法來鞚制煳評估高溫區的腐蝕。

sentences.english: The developed technique is applied to ambient air and automobile exhaust analysis.
sentences.chinese: 將研究所得的技術應用於環境空氣煳汽車廢氣的分析。

sentences.english: Everyone's immolationless care and attention makes her life full of sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 大家的無私照應煳關心使她的生活充滿了陽光。

sentences.english: Most of onset in children and adolescents.
sentences.chinese: 多數在兒童煳青少年期起病。

sentences.english: On one hand your life is enhanced by your dreams and aspirations.
sentences.chinese: 一方面，你的生活因爲夢想煳渴望爾更加精彩。

sentences.english: I like to communicate with my family.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡煳我的家人溝通。

sentences.english: Your duties include checking the post and distributing it.
sentences.chinese: 你的職責是檢查煳發送郵件。

definition: see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
to bake/to heat by fire/to set off by contrast
half-cooked/(fig.) not completely done, solved, developed etc/Taiwan pr. [jia4 sheng5]
to stir-fry before broiling or stewing
